title: Rax-Schneeberg Group
text:
The Rax-Schneeberg Group () is a <a href="mountain%20range">mountain range</a> in the <a href="Northern%20Limestone%20Alps">Northern Limestone Alps</a> on the <a href="Styria">Styria</a>n-<a href="Lower%20Austria">Lower Austria</a>n border in <a href="Austria">Austria</a>.
Location.
According to the official classification of the Eastern Alps by the Alpine Club ("<a href="Alpenvereinseinteilung%20der%20Ostalpen">Alpenvereinseinteilung der Ostalpen</a>"), the Rax-Schneeberg Group is bounded by the following divisions to neighbouring groups of mountains:
Summits.
The highest point in the limestone massif of the <a href="Schneeberg%20%28Lower%20Austria%29">Schneeberg</a> is the "Klosterwappen" at . Its nearby <a href="twin%20peak">twin peak</a> is known as the "<a href="Schneeberg%20%28Lower%20Austria%29">Kaiserstein</a>" (). The two summits are the highest mountains in the state of Lower Austria. The highest two elevations in the <a href="Rax">Rax</a> <a href="massif">massif</a> are the "<a href="Heukuppe">Heukuppe</a>" at 2,007 m and the "Scheibwaldhöhe" at 1,943 m.
Other peaks are the Große Scheibe (1,473 m), the Tratenkogel (1,565 m), the Ochnerhöhe (1,403 m) and the Kreuzberg (1,084 m).
Protected areas.
The Rax Alpine region, together with the Schneealpe and Schneeberg belong to the river source protected area ("Quellschutzgebiet") of the <a href="First%20Vienna%20Mountain%20Spring%20Pipeline">First Vienna Mountain Spring Pipeline</a> ("I. Wiener Hochquellenwasserleitung"). The Schneeberg and Rax are separated by the <a href="H%C3%B6llental%20%28Lower%20Austria%29">Höllental</a> valley and are two of <a href="Vienna%20Hausberge">Vienna's "local mountains" or "Hausberge"</a>.
The Schneeberg and Rax lie within the Northeastern Border Alps: Hohe Wand-Schneeberg-Rax Special Area of Conservation ("FFH-Gebiet Nordöstliche Randalpen: Hohe Wand-Schneeberg-Rax").
Schneeberg Railway.
The Schneeberg has been linked for over 100 years by the <a href="Schneeberg%20Railway">Schneeberg Railway</a> ("Schneebergbahn"), a <a href="cog%20railway">cog railway</a> that climbs to a height of 1,800 m. The twin peaks may be reached from the valley station in one to two hours. The footpath runs eastwards over the "Hengst" or westwards through the "Fadenwände."
There are trails to the Rax from the mountain spa of <a href="Puchberg%20am%20Schneeberg">Puchberg am Schneeberg</a>, and from the wild "<a href="H%C3%B6llental%20%28Lower%20Austria%29">Höllental</a>" valley to the south. In addition the Schneeberg may be approached from <a href="Payerbach">Payerbach</a>, <a href="Prigglitz">Prigglitz</a> and <a href="Reichenau%20an%20der%20Rax">Reichenau</a> via the "<a href="Gahns">Gahns</a>".
